original:
Neuropathology is the branch of pathology that focuses on the study of diseases affecting the nervous system, primarily through the examination of nervous tissue samples. This examination is typically conducted on surgical biopsies or, in some cases, entire brains during autopsy procedures. Neuropathology is recognized as a subspecialty of anatomic pathology, neurology, and neurosurgery.

In many English-speaking countries, neuropatholo
